thread.title: Chivas-Atlas players look forward to rivalry game in San Jose
thread.title_full: Chivas-Atlas players look forward to rivalry game in San Jose

author:
Elliott Almond

ealmond@mercurynews.com
title: Chivas-Atlas players look forward to rivalry game in San Jose
text:
Chivas-Atlas players look forward to rivalry game in San Jose By Elliott Almond Posted: 10/07/2015 07:01:17 PM PDT Updated: 10/07/2015 07:15:27 PM PDT SAN JOSE -- Don't expect popular soccer teams from Guadalajara to enjoy a vacation next month when renewing their city rivalry known as el Clasico Tapatio in an exhibition at Avaya Stadium. 
After 99 years, the series between the Club Deportivo Guadalajara and Atlas FC carries the kind of emotions found in the best sporting rivalries. 
"There is no friendly about it," Atlas goalkeeper Miguel Fraga said Wednesday in Spanish. "You win or you win. That's what it's all about." 
Representatives from Atlas and Chivas, as C.D. Guadalajara is affectionately called, came to San Jose to promote the Nov. 14 game that promoters expect to sell out. Tickets go on sale at 10 a.m. Friday through Ticketmaster or Avaya Stadium. Prices start at $35. 
The game follows a Mexican League showdown between the teams Oct. 24 in Guadalajara. Chivas currently is in 10th place, Atlas 14th in Liga MX. 
But like with the Giants and Los Angeles Dodgers, records don't matter when they meet. 
"It is more than the three points, it is the civic pride," said Juan Mariano Varela, Chivas' sports manager. 
Chivas leads the series 79-64-63 after the teams played to a scoreless draw in July in a preseason exhibition in front of 16,821 fans in Fresno. But Atlas' Fraga had a prediction about the upcoming games. 
"We are going to win two this year," he said. Advertisement 
Guadalajara midfielder Jorge Enriquez wasn't going to make a prediction Wednesday. But he likes taking the derby to California where the team has thousands of followers. Enriquez said that it's important to give fans north of the border a chance to experience the rivalry's atmosphere in Mexico's second-largest city. 
"We want to bring some of that contagious fever here," he said. Contact Elliott Almond at 408-920-5865. Follow him on Twitter at twitter.com/elliottalmond . nov. 14 match
